pr_title: Impl ModelBakeEvent, ModelRegistryEvent and some ModelLoader methods

timeline.message: Impl ModelBakeEvent, ModelRegistryEvent and some ModelLoader methods

timeline.author: TheGlitch76

replies.bodyText: We cannot rename this class, its methods are used by forge mods
replies.author: rikka0w0

timeline.bodyText:
Abstract implies a class.
Maybe something like SpecialModelProvider?

timeline.bodyText: This class needs some docs on why you are hijacking the trident, and why it can't be something else.
timeline.author: TheGlitch76

timeline.bodyText: You can leave these as normal names and use @Unique
timeline.author: TheGlitch76
TheGlitch76

replies.bodyText: We can't have private abstract methods in Java/////
replies.author: rikka0w0

replies.bodyText: Here we have to keep the dummy implementation
replies.author: rikka0w0

timeline.bodyText: Couldn't forge's MdoelLoader magic be done with a mixin implementing the interface? That would be more compatible with Fabric mods and a trivial redirect (all non-static methods of X class) in Patcher
timeline.author: TheGlitch76

replies.bodyText: On further consideration I think this approach is fine.
replies.author: TheGlitch76

replies.bodyText: Forge's ModelLoader is reference by Forge APIs and Mods access it directly. We have to keep the class and method signature to maintain compatibility.
replies.author: rikka0w0

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this needs to be essentially a class overwrite.
timeline.author: TheGlitch76

replies.bodyText: Actually this is fine how it is.
replies.author: TheGlitch76

timeline.bodyText: Considering there are multiple occurrences of addModel in the constructor, wouldn't this spam Patchwork was unable to load special models for Forge mods to the console?
timeline.author: famous1622

replies.bodyText: This specifically targets the third occurence of addModel, so it'll only be called once.
replies.author: kitlith

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            	 * Due to the limitation of mixin, when targeting a constructor, we cannot use injection points other than "TAIL".
          
          
            
            	 * Due to the limitations of mixin, when targeting a constructor, we cannot use injection points other than "TAIL".
timeline.author: famous1622

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            	 * There are multiple occurrence of addModel in the constructor, Forge inserts the patch after adding model for the trident.
          
          
            
            	 * There are multiple occurrences of addModel in the constructor, Forge inserts the patch after adding model for the trident.

replies.bodyText: I'd also consider "While there are..." or "...constructor, but Forge...", but I don't want to bikeshed too hard over grammar.
replies.author: famous1622

timeline.bodyText: I'd drop the official and make it capital Forge to be consistent.

+package net.patchworkmc.impl.modelloader;
+
+import java.util.Map;
+
+import net.minecraftforge.client.event.ModelBakeEvent;
+import net.minecraftforge.client.event.ModelRegistryEvent;
+import net.minecraftforge.client.model.ModelLoader;
+import net.minecraftforge.fml.ModLoader;
+
+import net.minecraft.client.render.model.BakedModel;
+import net.minecraft.client.render.model.BakedModelManager;
+import net.minecraft.util.Identifier;
+
+public class ModelEventDispatcher {
+	/**
+	 * In official forge, ModelRegistryEvent is fired in parallel with FMLClientSetupEvent.
+	 * Here we fire ModelRegistryEvent before FMLClientSetupEvent.
+	 * The official forge does not set the ModLoadingContext here, so this should be fine.
